frameset.note: Frames file for 'get' based on initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'buy', 'gain' and 'take'

roleset.name: transfer of goods, acquire

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: Could I get a one-way ticket from Milwaukee to Orlando?
example.arg: a one-way ticket from Milwaukee to Orlando

example.name: with price
example.text: They get something equally good for less.

example.name: with source
example.text: The march got its support from self-serving groups.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: John got some flowers for his mother.

example.name: price as subject
example.text: $15 gets you a lot of daisies.

roleset.note: Sometimes necessary to delve into the syntax to separate args.

example.name: always with have auxiliary?
example.text: You've got two champions sitting right before you.
example.arg: two champions sitting right before you

roleset.name: become

example.name: basic becoming
example.text: That got hard to take.

example.name: it support
example.text: It's getting harder *trace* to sell.

roleset.note: We're not trying to sell "it"; the deep syntax is "*trace to sell is becoming/getting harder (than it used to be)".

example.name: get across
example.text: Wilder has gotten across the idea that Coleman will say anything.
example.arg: across the idea that Coleman will say anything

example.name: become with agent
example.text: They got us thinking, "maybe we could be doing PAS tagging!"
example.arg: us thinking, "maybe we could be doing PAS tagging!"

example.name: cause
example.text: They get big studios to bankroll and distribute the films.
example.arg: big studios to bankroll and distribute the films

example.name: metaphorical motion
example.text: Financing problems caused a nine-month delay in *trace* getting the product to market.

example.name: destination and source all at once
example.text: [*] Getting to and from the airport in coming weeks may be the problem, however.

example.name: get as must
example.text: We've got to take a serious look at how we're doing our jobs.
example.arg: to take a serious look at how we're doing our jobs

roleset.name: produce

example.name: become?
example.text: [The company]-1 is certain *trace*-1 to get out some aircraft with just supervisors and other non-striking employees on hand.
example.arg: with just supervisors and other non-striking employees on hand.

roleset.note: Could be regarded as non-phrasal "become" sense, but putting the attribute as "out" is a little weird. But some sentences do have "out" as a clear predicate: "I'm getting out (of the market)".

example.name: manage
example.text: Buyers may not get away with some of the things they've done in the past.
example.arg: with some of the things they've done in the past.

example.name: no 'source'
example.text: John-1 wants *trace*-1 to get his money back.

roleset.name: return

example.name: back to normal
example.text: UAL trading would get back to normal.

roleset.note: Equivalent to "to" variant of "become variant" above, possibly also other usages of "become variant" or even "become" rolesets.

example.name: all args
example.text: Oh please you never wondered how-1 *PRO* to get back at the police for *PRO* writing you a speeding ticket *T*-1
example.arg: for *PRO* writing you a speeding ticket.

example.name: almost idiomatic
example.text: A new $46 million steel rod minimill got off to a rocky start in early 1988.
example.arg: A new $46 million steel rod minimill

example.name: London calling
example.text: Two years ago there was trouble with people getting through on the phone.

example.name: with Arg1
example.text: John couldn't get through to Mary.

example.name: nobody knows...
example.text: With nothing but a good attitude, John got through the worst the University had to offer.
example.arg: With nothing but a good attitude
the worst the University had to offer.

example.text: [ When] the Asian Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy met in Auckland, New Zealand [ *T*-9], I got along wonderfully for two days with John Ni, who [ *T*-1] was there in his capacity as Director-General of the Medium and Small Business Administration.
example.arg: with John Ni, [ *T*-1] who was there in his capacity as Director-General of the Medium and Small Business Administration

role.descr: what getting by with or without

example.name: bless technology
example.text: "I do n't know [how] I could get by without my mobile phone *T*-9," exclaims *T* Chang.

example.name: get down, baby
example.text: John will get down to business next week.

example.name: all args
example.text: Partners at other accounting firms say that [the Deloitte firm in the U.K]'-1. is filing the suit [*-1] to get even with the merged Deloitte-Touche firm for [*-2] keeping major auditing work in England.
example.arg: for [*-2] keeping major auditing work in England

example.name: meet
example.text: Mr. Guber got together with Mr. Peters.
His mother and father did not get on well together.

example.name: The business of life
example.text: Jerry can get on with the business of building a life for himself.
example.arg: with the business of building a life for himself
